intro: Cacalia chalybaea, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a silvery-gray appearance due to a dense covering of fine hairs. Cacalia chalybaea is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in partial to full sunlight.
